issue.title: [R] create_package_with_all_dependencies() fails on Windows 10
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-15608](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15608). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I installed the Arrow Package inside a fresh R-Install on Windows and tried to use the function create_package_with_all_dependencies():

```Java

> create_package_with_all_dependencies('C:\\Daten\\test.tar.gz')
Downloading Arrow source file
versuche URL 'https://mirror.dogado.de/cran/src/contrib/arrow_6.0.1.tar.gz'
Content type 'application/octet-stream' length 4774511 bytes (4.6 MB)
downloaded 4.6 MB

Downloading files to C:\Users\Max\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpUDlurF\fileeb049a548f8/arrow/tools/thirdparty_dependencies
Fehler in create_package_with_all_dependencies("C:\\Daten\\test.tar.gz") : 
  Failed to download thirdparty dependencies
```

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15608?focusedCommentId=17488674) by Maximilian König (max_koe):*
This is a seemingly similar bug to ARROW-15092, that I also encountered while trying to tackle ARROW-15000. (Though I suppose the underlying cause is of course different)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15608?focusedCommentId=17526879) by Karl Dunkle Werner (karldw):*
